authorAttributions.displayName: The New York Otolaryngology Group PC
The New York Otolaryngology Group PC

adrFormatAddress: At the Hotel Des Artistes, 9 W 67th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
TLDR; If I had the option again, I definitely would have went to a different office.

Last year, I went to this office for a minor ear infection. The doctor was nice, nothing against the provider, but their billing practices are very sketchy. I expected to be charged around the $175-$200 range for an office visit, but there were unnecessary tests done. They charged my insurance around $3000, even with in-network rates the visit out-of-pocket total is $550, which is more than double what I was expecting.

I get that our American medical system is horrible and it continues to perpetuate this cycle of providers up-charging the insurance and insurance reimbursing less, but it leaves patients/consumers with the short end of the stick. Do better, New York Otolaryngology Group. At least have the decency to provide your patients with financial transparency before the visit ends.

originalText.text: Usually I never post anything negative on a service, but this one is an exception. I had a small ear infection, and saw several ear doctors and they charge for around 200 dollars. This one before the doctor even saw me, they requested me to do many unnecessary tests, and then charged me over 2000 dollars. Again this is just a small infection (swimming ear) and I just needed some medicine. Be very careful to come here

originalText.text: After experiencing sudden hearing loss I walked in with no appointment and was treated wonderfully by the staff and doctors.
